com.pump.image.transition

Class AbstractTransition

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.pump.image.transition.AbstractTransition
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Transition
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Transition2D, Transition3D

    public abstract class AbstractTransition
extends java.lang.Object
implements Transition
    This abstract class handles bounds checking.

    • Method Detail

      • createImage

        public static java.awt.image.BufferedImage createImage(java.lang.String text,
                                                       boolean light)
        Create an image with the text provided and a gradient background. This is intended to facilitate simple demos of transitions.
        Parameters:
        text - the text to render, probably just 1 or 2 letters will do.
        light - whether to use a light (red/yellow) background or a dark (green/blue) background.
        Returns:
        an image to test transitions with.

      • createImage

        public static java.awt.image.BufferedImage createImage(int size,
                                                       java.lang.String text,
                                                       boolean light,
                                                       boolean useGradients)
        Create an image with the text provided. This is intended to facilitate simple demos of transitions.
        Parameters:
        size - the width and height of this image.
        text - the text to render, probably just 1 or 2 letters will do.
        light - whether to use a light (red/yellow) background or a dark (green/blue) background.
        useGradients - whether to use gradients as a background or not.
        Returns:
        an image to test transitions with.

      • paint

        public final void paint(java.awt.Graphics2D g,
                        java.awt.image.BufferedImage frameA,
                        java.awt.image.BufferedImage frameB,
                        float progress)
        Specified by:
        paint in interface Transition
        Parameters:
        g - the Graphics2D to render to.
        frameA - the first frame
        frameB - the second frame
        progress - a value between zero and one indicating how progressed this transition is.

        At progress = 0, frameA should be shown. At progress = 1, frameB should be shown.

      • doPaint

        protected abstract void doPaint(java.awt.Graphics2D g,
                                java.awt.image.BufferedImage frameA,
                                java.awt.image.BufferedImage frameB,
                                float progress)
        Paint this transition. This method is invoked after bounds checking for all the arguments.

      • getBounds

        protected static java.awt.geom.Rectangle2D getBounds(java.awt.geom.Point2D... p)
        Return a rectangle including all the points in the argument.
